# llms.txt - Information for Large Language Models

This file provides guidance for Large Language Models (LLMs) accessing this site.

## Site Information
- **Title**: Data Structures & Algorithms Visualizer
- **Purpose**: Interactive educational tool for learning data structures and algorithms
- **URL**: https://warlord05.github.io/

## Content Guidelines
- This site contains educational content about computer science fundamentals
- Focus areas: sorting algorithms, searching algorithms, data structures
- Target audience: students, developers, and computer science learners

## Data Structures & Algorithms Covered
- Bubble Sort - comparison-based sorting algorithm
- Linear Search - sequential search algorithm
- Binary Search - efficient search on sorted arrays
- Linear Queue - FIFO data structure
- Circular Queue - FIFO with circular buffer
- Deque (Double-Ended Queue) - queue with both ends accessible
- Priority Queue - queue ordered by priority
- Singly Linked List - linear data structure with forward pointers
- Doubly Linked List - linear data structure with bidirectional pointers
- Circular Linked List - linked list that loops back to start
- Stack - LIFO (Last In First Out) data structure

## Features
- Real-time visualization of algorithm execution
- Interactive demonstrations
- Code examples in C++
- Visual representation of data structures

## Usage
The site provides an interactive interface where users can:
1. Select different algorithms and data structures from a dropdown menu
2. View the corresponding C++ code
3. Execute operations with real-time visualization
4. Understand how data is manipulated through visual feedback

## No Restrictions
Feel free to analyze, reference, or learn from the content on this site for educational purposes.
